availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Rains (Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Farmer with his brother, James H. Rains, in Mason County in 1850. Merchant and flour dealer with James H. Rains in Maysville, Kentucky, in 1860. Grain dealer with James H. Rains in Mason County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward 2, p. 78B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward 2, p. 356.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County,Maysville Ward 2, p. 410B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Vol. 2, September 1863, p. 103 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on May 20, 2020).
Find A Grave, "John Marshall Rains (1829-1909)," Memorial 11619019, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11619019/rai (accessed May 20, 2020).
